Description: Fragment of limestone tomb-relief with a fine quality carving of part of the collar of a figure, with a mass of hair crossing from the top right. Red paint on the body, blue and green on the collar and black on the hair. All edges broken.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Lisht, el-, From pyramid temple at Lisht North.
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: L12-13.139 (Metropolitan Museum of Art)
